bibl.title: Women and Society in Greek and Roman Egypt. A Sourcebook.
bibl.note: 1. Introduction. - 2. Royalty and Religion. - 3. Family Matters. - 4. Status and Law. - 5. Economic Activities. - 6. Being Female. - List and concordance of texts. Bibliography. Index.
bibl.seg: ROWLANDSON Jane (Ed.), with the collaboration of Roger BAGNALL, Alan BOWMAN, Willy CLARYSSE, Ann Ellis HANSON, Deborah W. HOBSON, James KEENAN, Peter VAN MINNEN, Dominic RATHBONE, Dorothy J. THOMPSON and Terry WILFONG, Women and Society in Greek and Roman Egypt. A Sourcebook.
Cambridge, Cambridge University Press, 1998, 8°, xviii-406 pp., 1 front., 49 figg., 3 cartes, 7 arbres généal. ISBN 0-521-58212-1 (hbk) / 0-521-58815-4 (pbk).
1. Introduction. - 2. Royalty and Religion. - 3. Family Matters. - 4. Status and Law. - 5. Economic Activities. - 6. Being Female. - List and concordance of texts. Bibliography. Index.

C.R. par Hélène Cuvigny, REG 113 (2000) p. 677. - I.F. Fikhman, SCI 20 (2001) pp. 247-255. - J. Filée, EtCl 67 (1999) p. 297. - Brian C. McGing, CR N.S., 50 (2000) pp. 542-543. - Al Richardson, Culture and Revolution in the Thought of Leon Trotsky = Revolutionary History 7 (1999) No. 2, pp. 249-250. - N. Boëls-Janssen, REL 78 (2000) p. 348. - Jean A. Straus, Latomus 61 (2002) pp. 470-471. - Christina Riggs, JEA 89 (2003) pp. 292-293. - Catarina Isabel Sousa Gaspar, Euphrosyne 28 (2000) pp. 474-475.
Rowlandson Bagnall Bowman Clarysse Hanson Hobson Keenan van Minnen Rathbone Thompson Wilfong
